ratings.comment: I took AAS271 with Prof. Almiron. I only took the class for ethnic study credits but her class really blew my mind. She is good at driving discussions and presenting course materials. She cares about all her students and is a very inspirational individual. I would love to take her classes again!

Professor Almiron did such a good job teaching my class. Usually I don't write these sort of things but I felt I had to give credit where due. She is energetic and takes the time to get to know you, total people person. I would highly recommend taking this class, it was interesting and a good use of my time (rare to find in a 50+ student lecture).

My class with Dr. Almiron was by far my favorite class I've ever taken as an undergrad. She is compassionate and enthusiastic and her class is never dull. Most importantly, you feel like you are seen, heard, and felt no matter who you are when you are in her class and that is rare for some of us on this campus. We are truly lucky to have her at UW

Professor Almiron is the cool aunt. She's funny, relaxed, relatable, intelligent and caring. Her class is so much fun! She always makes jokes or does funny dances to pep us up when we're not talkative. And now about her teaching - incredible. She is full of love and passion. Rare to find nowadays; take it, you won't regret it.

Johanna Almiron is a professor who comes to teach, not get research money and promote her own name. She is always there for students and challenges us to have deep discussions in class. If you do not want to think, do not take her class. If you don't mind talking a bit to your peers take this, the grading is fair, and the lectures are interesting.

Professor Almiron has a really great vibe to her. You can tell she's really passionate about what she teaches and it definitely rubs off on the class. Even people who just took the course for their ethnic studies requirement got really into the discussions.  If you go in with an open mind, this class will change your life.

Professor Almiron was easily the most engaging professor I've had. You could tell she really cared about the subject and the goal was always to make sure we were learning and growing not just memorizing facts. I was nervous that a discussion with 50 people would be intimidating, but she created such a comfortable environment that it really wasn't.

Prof. Almiron inspired a newfound outlook on the current social climate within UW-Madison. In light of recent racial incidence we stand in support as she gave us the tools and knowledge to tackle these problems head on. The class is engaging and empowering as Prof. Almiron leads by example. By far the most impactful class that I have taken at UW.
